ext_descriptions.ext_description: An Activity is an identification of the occurrence of an action that has taken place, is taking place, or is expected to take place in the future. The procedure executed during that Activity is identified with the Activity_method that is referred to by the chosen_method attribute. Change, distilling, design, a process to drill a hole, and a task such as training someone, are examples of activities. The items that are affected by an Activity, for example as input or output, may be identified within an instance of Activity_assignment.
the identifier for the Activity.

ext_description.p: the activity_type specifies the purpose of the Activity.
The following values shall be used for activity_type:

ul.li: 'amendment': An Activity to add information to product data;
'analysis': An Activity to determine the behaviour of an element under certain physical circumstances;
'cancellation': An Activity to delete an element from the bill of material or to cancel the whole bill of material;
'delivery change': An Activity to change the delivery schedule of an element;
'design change': An Activity to change the design of an item or an assembly; this might include changes to the geometry or to properties of the object;
'design': An Activity concerning the development of a design of an item;
'mock-up creation': An Activity to create an experimental model or replica of an item;
'prototype building': An Activity to manufacture a preliminary version of an item;
'rectification': An Activity to correct the data, documentation or structure associated with an item;
'restructuring': An Activity to create a new structure or position within a bill of material without changing the data associated with the items in the bill of material;
'spare part creation': An Activity to design a spare part or to classify an item as a spare part;
'stop notice': An Activity to stop the manufacturing process of an item;
'testing': An Activity to test an item;
'work definition': An Activity to manage several sub-activities related to this Activity by an Activity_relationship with a 'relation_type' of value 'decomposition'.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the actual_end_date specifies the date when the Activity actually finished. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the actual_start_date specifies the date when the Activity actually started. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the textual definition of the attribute. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the Activity_method that specifies the procedure selected to carry out the Activity. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the concerned_organizations specifies the set of Organization objects that are affected by the result of the Activity. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the text that provides further information about the Activity. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the planned_end_date specifies the date when the Activity is or was supposed to be finished. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the planned_start_date specifies the date when the Activity is or was supposed to be started. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the requestor specifies the Person or Organization that requested the Activity and the date the request was submitted. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the resolved_request specifies the set of Work_request objects that are resolved by the Activity. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the status specifies the level of completion of the Activity. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.example: The value 'open' is an example for status.
ext_description.note: The values and sequence of status are company specific.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the supplying_organization specifies the set of Organization objects that carry out the work. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the textual definition of the attribute.

An Activity_assignment is a an association of an Activity with product or activity data. It characterizes the role of the concepts represented with these data with respect to the activity. This entity should not be used to represent the association of an activity with the organizations that are responsible for its execution or its management. That kind of information can be represented with instances of Organization_or_person_in_organization_assignment.

ext_description.p: the text that specifies the purpose of the association of the Activity_assignment with product or activity data. Where applicable, the following values shall be used for role:

ul.li: 'input': the concepts represented by the items are inputs of the Activity,
'output': the concepts represented by the items result from the Activity,
'constraint': the concepts represented by the items influence the execution of the Activity.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the set of activity_assignment_select that are associated with the assigned_activity.
the text that specifies the purpose of the association of the Activity_assignment with product or activity data.

ext_description.p: An Activity_method is a way to carry out an Activity.
ext_description.note: There may be more than one method for producing a required result.
This definition may be used to characterize a way to resolve a request for action. The concept of action request is dealt with in module Work request.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the text that describes the results of application of this method. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the text that provides further information about the Activity_method. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the words by which the Activity_method is known.
the text that provides an informal description of the reason for the Activity_method.
An Activity_method_relationship is a relationship between two instances of Activity_method.
the text that provides further information about the Activity_method_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the other instance of Activity_method that is part of the relationship.
the first instance of Activity_method that is part of the relationship.
the textual definition of the attribute.

An Activity_method_work_request_association is aan association between an Activity_method and a Work_request. The associated Activity_method serves as a recommended or non-recommended method to resolve the tasks specified in the Work_request. The relation_type attribute characterizes the meaning of that association and the meaning of the Activity_method with respect to the Work_request.
the associated_activity_method identifies the Activity_method that is recommended or that shall not be chosen.
the associated_work_request identifies the Work_request that the recommended or non-recommended method applies to.

ext_description.p: the relation_type specifies whether the specified Activity_method may be used or not. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'non recommended method': The specified Activity_method shall not be used in order to accomplish the specified Work_request,
'recommended method': The specified Activity_method may be used in order to accomplish the specified Work_request.

ext_description.p: An Alias_identification is a mechanism to associate an object with an additional identifier that is used to identify the object of interest in a different context, either in another , or in some other context. The scope of the Alias_identification shall be specified either by the attribute scope or by the attribute description.
ext_description.note: Alias_identification only applies to concepts that possess an attribute that conveys an identifier or a name.
ext_description.example: A document (e.g., a book) may have a unique document id (ISBN) and an Alias_identification as inventory number in the context of the inventory of a company.

ext_description.p: the text that provides further information about the Alias_identification. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.example: The description may be, e.g., 'inventory number'.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the identifier for the Alias_identification.

ext_description.p: the object that has an Alias_identification.
ext_description.note: If applied to a , it is not the id but the name attribute that has this alias.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the in which the Alias_identification is valid. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the version of the object as known in the context of the Alias_identification. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.note: A version_id may be applied even if the object of interest does not have versions.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An Alternate_part_relationship is an association between two instances of Part. It specifies that any version of the alternate part, may be used in place of any version of the base part, regardless of its usages and of its versions. The relationship established by the Alternate_part_relationship is not symmetric: if B is an alternate part for A, A is not implied to be an alternate part for B. If a part is an alternate for another part, it is understood that there is no interest to keep track of which part, the base or any alternates specified, is used as a particular instance of the base part within a part structure An organization may track design changes for a base part, and establish effectivity conditions for the use of that base part in various assemblies to be manufactured. The use of an alternate part implies that an organization does not specify any particular version of the alternate part nor establish effectivities relating to it An Alternate_part_relationship may relate parts of any kind, provided both related instances of Part identify parts of the same part category. An Alternate_part_relationship for which the base part is an assembly involves that the entire part structure of the alternate part may be used in place of the base part and its part structure. This concept usually refers to form, fit, function, and quality. Additional properties such as performance, noise, endurance, or reliability may also be considered as a prerequisite for the replacement Two bolts of the same size are parts. One bolt has a square head and the other has a hexagonal head. The two bolts are considered equivalent with respect to form, fit, and function: they both have sufficiently close physical shape, they take up the same space when used, and they both serve to fasten two things together. Thus, one of these two bolts could be considered to be an alternate part for the other bolt.
specifies the Part that may be used in place of the base Part.
specifies the Part for which another Part may be used as a replacement.

the text that provides further information about the Alternate_part_relationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: specifies the word or group of words describing the requirements that are covered by both the base and the alternate and therefore are the basis for the statement regarding the capability of of replacing the base part by the alternate part. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.example: Additional properties such as performance, noise, endurance, or reliability may also be considered as a prerequisite for the replacement in addition to form, fit, function, and quality.

An Application_context is a the grouping of an application domain and a life cycle stage. It identifies a universe of discourse suitable for the description of parts. Requirements and vocabularies vary among the industrial activity fields. This entity intends to identify such domains.

ext_description.p: the identification of the applications for which an object may be relevant. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'assembly study': The object may be relevant for an assembly study;
'digital mock-up': The object may be relevant for digital mock-up;
'electrical design': The object may be relevant for the electrical design;
'mechanical design': The object may be relevant for the mechanical design;
'preliminary design': The object may be relevant for the preliminary design;
'process planning': The object may be relevant for the process planning.
'not specific': The object is considered as not specific of any application domain.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the text that provides further information about the Application_context.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the general stage in the product life cycle to which the concerned items belong. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'design': The concerned item belongs to the design phase of the life cycle;
'manufacturing': The concerned item belongs to the manufacturing phase of the life cycle;
'recycling': The concerned item belongs to the recycling phase of the life cycle.
'not specific': The object is considered as not specific of any life cycle stage.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An Approval is a judgement and formal confirmation of the quality of those product or activity data that are subject of the Approval. An Approval represents a statement made by technical personnel or management personnel whether certain requirements are met. The absence of approval information does not imply any approval status by default.

ext_description.p: the point in time when the Approval actually became valid. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.note: In cases, where more than one person or organization has to sign off on the Approval, usually the last sign-off date corresponds to the date specified as the actual date.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the personnel responsible for the Approval and the dates of the Approval. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the point in time when the Approval is or was supposed to be performed. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the text that completes the information provided within the status attribute, specifying the reason or goal of the Approval.
ext_description.example: 'released for production' or 'preliminary design completed' are approval purposes.

example.p: Where applicable, the following values may be used:

ul.li: 'disposition': The referenced object is approved for series production;
'equipment order': The referenced object has reached a status in which changes are subject to a defined change process and tools and other equipment required for production may be ordered;
'planning': The referenced object is technically complete and has reached a status sufficiently stable so that other designs may be based on it.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the set of objects for which the Approval is valid. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: a user interpretable designation of the level of acceptance of the object that the Approval is assigned to, in the context of the specified purpose.
ext_description.note: The approval purposes are defined within a given life cycle stage view and are typically dependent upon the approval cycles within an individual business process. For each defined purpose, generally there is a defined sequence of values for the status, usually leading towards the status 'approved' indicating achievement of the particular purpose.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An Approval_assignment is an association of an to activity or product data.
the that is assigned to activity or product data.
the set of activity or product data to which the is assigned.
An Approval_relationship is a typed association between two instances of .

the text that provides further information about the Approval_relationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the first of the two objects related by the Approval_relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent of the other, this attribute shall be the dependent one.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the second of the two objects related by the Approval_relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent of the other, this attribute shall be the independent or owning one.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the text that specifies the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable, the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'decomposition': The related is one of the components into which the relating is broken down with no implication of 'sequence' or 'dependency';

'dependency': The issuing of the related is dependent on the issuing of the relating ;
The value 'dependency' does not imply the semantics of the values 'decomposition' or 'sequence'.
The of an assembly may be dependent on the of all of the constituents of the assembly.
In two parallel sequences of approvals for two assemblies a certain approval of one assembly may be dependent on a certain approval of the second assembly.
'precedence': The related has higher priority than the relating ;
'sequence': The relating shall be completed before the related is given.

ext_description.p: Informal proposition: The graph of instances of , related by instances of Approval_relationship, shall be acyclic.

ext_description.p:
A Centre_of_mass is a type of
that is the centre of the mass of a body. The relative position of the Centre_of_mass within the body is an invariant datum relative to rotation and translation. The Centre_of_mass is a characteristic of a part, not its shape.
ext_description.note: If a shape representation is present, the Centre_of_mass is usually derivable from the shape representation. However, as a characteristic of a part, it may be pre-defined in order to reflect a requirement.
In order to convey the information about the actual centre of mass of a geometric model, the use of with value 'centroid' for its attribute 'property_type' is appropriate.

ext_description.p: the in which the property is applicable.
ext_description.note: The values of geometry related properties are specified relative to a .
ext_description.example: A Centre_of_mass may be specified in different coordinate spaces for different dimensioning applications.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: a point in three-dimensional space that defines the location of a Centre_of_mass in the .

ext_description.p: A Certification is a certificate. It asserts satisfaction of particular quality criteria.
ext_description.note: Certification information can be attached to any aspect of product or activity data.

ext_description.p: the text that identifies the kind of the Certification.
ext_description.example: 'supplier certificate' is an example of a certification_type.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the text that provides further information about the Certification.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the words by which the Certification is known.
ext_description.example: 'AP 242 certified' is an example of a name that can be used to indicate a certification of a STEP interface.
'ISO 9000' is an example of a name that can be used to indicate that a product has been developed following ISO 9000 directives.

ext_description.p: A Class_category_association is an association of a with a . Additionally, this assignment specifies if the usage of one or more objects belonging to this , is mandatory or optional for all products of that .
ext_description.note: The assignment of a to a does not replace the association of single members of the to the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the that is associated with the .
the for which the is valid.

ext_description.p: specifies whether the objects referring to the associated have to be used or may be used (optional) for products within the referenced . A value of 'true' indicates that the usage is mandatory.
ext_description.example: The specification category 'radio' may be associated 'optional' to the product class of a car; the specification category 'engine' is an example for a 'mandatory' association.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Class_condition_association is an association of a with a . The meaning of this association is specified further by the attribute condition_type.
specifies the that is assigned to the .
specifies the for which the is valid.

ext_description.p: specifies the meaning of the association. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li:
'design case': The specifies a condition when a given object has to be designed and verified. This value of the condition_type is for information only and shall not be interpreted when querying design cases or usage cases. For such a query, the value of the attribute configuration_type of shall be evaluated;
This value may be used to precise when a given or a given has to be studied by the design department so that it provides solutions appropriate for the case specified by the attributes associated_condition and associated_product_class.

'identification': The specifies a condition that enables to distinguish the associated from other objects. This value is not applicable for a top level node in a hierarchy of objects. This identification is part of the identification of all sub classes of this ;

'part usage': The specifies a condition for the usage of the components of an , the usage of an or for the application of a or a in the products of the associated_product_class. In this case, the Class_condition_association shall be referenced by at least one object;

'validity': The specifies a condition that is used to verify a for the associated_product_class. That means that the evaluates to 'true' if the set of objects is valid; otherwise it evaluates to 'false' with the meaning that the specified object is invalid for the . The associated_condition is valid for all products belonging to the associated_product_class if condition_type is 'identification' or 'validity'.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the text that provides further information about the Class_condition_association.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the kind of availability of a particular in a . Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li:
'availability': The is a potential characteristic of any product belonging to a high level . It is not specified if this is an option or a standard;
'front wheel drive' or 'four wheel drive' are available for a product class 'Voyager'.

'identification': The is a characteristic that enables to distinguish the associated from other objects. This is a kind of 'non replaceable standard'. This value is not applicable for a top level node in a hierarchy of objects. This identification is part of the identification of all sub classes of this ;
The car body type 'limousine' is identifying product class 'S40'.

'non replaceable standard': The is a characteristic of all products belonging to the ;
'South East Asia climate zone' is a 'non replaceable standard' for a car that is produced for use in that particular geographic area.

'option': The is a characteristic of a product if explicitly chosen. The replaces another of the same if the replaced is associated with the as 'replaceable standard';
'sun roof' or 'radio with CD' are common options proposed to the customer.
'part usage': The is a characteristic for the usage of the components of an , the usage of an , or for the application of a or a in the products of the associated ;

'replaceable standard': The is a default characteristic of the products belonging to the as long as no other of the same is chosen.
'power brake' is a 'replaceable standard' for product class 'Golf'; it can be replaced by 'ABS', which is another specification of the same specification category 'brake system'.

ext_description.p: A Configuration is a the association of a Class_condition_association or a Class_specification_association object with a design or with a process in order to define a valid usage of it in the context of a certain Product_class
ext_description.note: The validity of the association may be limited by a time period through assigning an Effectivity object to it.
The semantics of the kind of association is defined by the attributes 'configuration_type' and 'inher-itance_type'.

ext_description.p: the valid usage of a Configuration object that is applied to the application object as configured_element. The following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'design': The object referenced as 'configured_element' has to be designed and verified before it can actually be used in a given context. This context is specified by the Class_condition_association and Class_specification_association objects referenced as the 'is_solution_for'. This type of Configuration is applicable for Alternative_solution, Breakdown_element, Process_plan, or Process_operation_occurrence objects;

'usage': The object referenced as the 'configured_element' is controlled by a Configuration. The Class_condition_association and Class_specification_association objects specify the usage cases and are referenced as the 'is_solution_for'.

ext_description.p: This type of Configuration is applicable for Alternative_solution, Part_instance, Process_plan, Process_operation_occurrence, or Physical_breakdonwn_element objects.
ext_description.example: The presence of an optional third rear axle of a truck is controlled by specifications on the level of Physical_breakdown_element.
A 'sun-roof' has to be provided, i.e., designed for a class of vehicles that has an optional 'sun-roof' as part of its specification.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the element that is controlled for its valid usage by the Configuration.

ext_description.p: specifies whether or not an inheritance scheme for the configuration information in a hierarchical structure is applied to the application object referenced as the configured_element. The levels within such a hierarchy are defined through Realization_or_occurrence_relationship objects or the attribute 'based_on' of Alternative_solution. The following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'exception': No inheritance scheme is applicable and all required configuration information must be attached locally at the application object. The value indicates that the configuration information may be inconsistent to the structural levels above it or that it is, on purpose, contradictory to it. Such a condition implies that an inheritance scheme shall not continue beyond this point in the product structure tree

ext_description.example: A situation where the inheritance_type 'exception' is applicable is a technical solution released for one particular customer without support in higher structure levels.

ul.li: 'inherited': A scheme for inheritance of configuration information applies. The complete configuration information shall be collected from the different levels in the structure by evaluation of results. The results shall be evaluated using the logical AND to combine configuration information starting at the referenced configured_element and using the logical OR to combine alternatives. In addition, this evaluation shall consider related effectivity information. 'inherited' only applies for objects for which the same value of 'configuration_type' is defined;

ext_description.example: The following figure shows how inheritance is applied along the tree of a product structure. The complete configuration information of a Part_instance can be obtained by adding any such information to Alternative_solution objects which are linked through Realiza-tion_or_occurrence_relationship objects and 'based_on' attributes respectively. Whenever more than one higher level instance is present, the current information available is branched in as many branches as instances are present. For example, the total configuration information for the Part_instance given in the figure above could be expressed as follows: (C0.0 AND C1.0 AND C2.0) OR (C0.0 AND C1.1 AND C2.1) OR (C0.0 AND C1.1 AND C2.2).

ul.li: 'local': No inheritance scheme is applicable and all required configuration information must be attached locally at the application object. Nevertheless, any potentially inherited configuration information of a higher level shall be consistent, i.e., it shall be a subset of the locally defined configuration information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the characteristic or combination of characteristics for which the object referenced as the configured_element provides a solution or which is needed to control a process operation. These characteristics are defined by a Class_specification_association and combinations of characteristics are defined by a Class_condition_association where the attribute 'condition type' is 'part usage'.

ext_description.p: A Contract is a binding agreement.
ext_description.example: Contracts may concern the design of part version objects, the delivery of drawing objects, or the execution of activity objects.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The value of this attribute need not be specified. other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the Contract.
the text that identifies the type of the Contract.

ext_description.p:

ext_description.p: A Data_environment is a specification of the conditions under that a Material_property is valid.
ext_description.example: A Data_environment may have the name 'standard', the description '20 degrees Celsius, 75% humidity' and links to the property objects that characterize 20 degrees Celsius and 75% humidity.

ext_description.example: Boiling point of water depends on pressure. An instance of Property may provide the pressure value that corresponds to a particular boiling temperature.

A Dated_configuration is a type of
that applies onwards from a given date, or between a start and an end date.

ext_description.p: A Dated_effectivity is a type of for which the domain of applicability is defined as an interval of time bounded by dates or events. The interval may be open-ended.
Depending on whether the end_bound attribute is specified, the actual domain of time defined by a Dated_effectivity is:

ul.li: either, the time interval between the start and end date or event;
or, the open time interval that starts at the start date or event.

ext_description.p: If the end_bound is an event that actually identifies a point in time that comes before the start_bound, then the actual domain of effectivity is empty.
ext_description.example: objects may be used to bound a Dated_effectivity period, which may be especially useful at a planning stage.

ext_description.p: the date or event that defines the upper bound of the interval of applicability. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If the value for this attribute is not specified, the interval of applicability has no upper limit.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the or that defines the lower bound of the interval of applicability.

ext_description.p: A Design_constraint is a a definition of a version of requirement that impacts the design of some physical or functional elements.
ext_description.note: In the present context, design of a functional or physical element means design of parts that realize or fulfills the functional or organic requirement.
ext_description.example: Ergonomic information like 'hip point' or 'forward driver vision' as well as 'door opening control lines', 'shipping critical dimensions', or 'stone throw zone' are examples of design constraint.
The standard diameter of soft drink cans is a constraint for designing the hole of a cup holder in a car.

'precedence': the related "Design_constraint" has higher priority than the relating "Design constraint definition".

A Document_assignment is a mechanism to associate a document with the objects, where the assigned document provides information about the object it is associated to.
the , a , a , or a that is used to provide information.

ext_description.p: the objects that information is provided for.
ext_description.example: A document assigned to may provide further description of the input or output of that activity.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the word or group of the words that convey the subject or sub contents of the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the meaning of the Document_assignment. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'additional information': The assigned document provides information that is relevant for the associated object, but is not a description of the associated object itself;
'behavior': The assigned document specifies information about the behaviour of the associated object;
'description': The assigned document provides textual information for the associated object itself;
'informative': The assigned document may or may not be considered;
'mandatory': The associated object shall conform to the content of the assigned document;
'mathematical description': The assigned document specifies the associated object by providing the algorithmic specification of its behavior.

ul.li: 'catalogue': The assigned document is the catalogue in which the associated object is listed; The document can be the catalogue of the manufacturer.
'manual': The assigned document is the handbook that is supplied for the associated object;
'specification': The assigned document specifies the considerations that lead to the design finally chosen for the associated object.

A Document_content_property specifies characteristics precising the content of a or of a . At least one of the optional attributes shall be specified for each instance of this object. In the case where a Document_content_property is referred by a , the characteristics apply to all individual objects, whereas in the case where it is referred by a , the characteristics apply on an individual basis.
other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the Document_content_property. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Document_content_property.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the level of detail that the or the provides. Where applicable the following values shall be used:
'rough 3d shape': 3D shape model without edge rounds and fillets;
'rounded edges': 3D shape model with edge rounds and fillets.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the kind or kinds of geometry that an object contains. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: '3D wireframe model': The document contains a 3D shape model in wireframe representation;
'2D shape': The document contains a 2D shape model or contours only;
'surface model': The document contains a 3D shape model in surface representation;
'closed volume': The document contains a 3D shape model in closed body topological surface representation;
'solid model': The document contains a 3D shape model in advanced boundary representation;
'solid and surface model': The document contains a 3D shape model in surface and advanced boundary representation;
'assembly': The document contains an assembly structure with reference to the assembled components and their transformation matrices;

'assembly with mating elements': The document contains an assembly structure including the mating components only, such as screws or rivets, with exact positioning information. This assembly representation is intended to be overlayed with the assembly structure for the main components;
'2D drawing': The document contains a technical drawing without 3D shape representation;
'drawing derived from 3D data': The document contains a technical drawing that has been derived from a 3D shape model;
'drawing related to 3D data': The document contains a technical drawing that visualizes a 3D shape model and possibly establishes associative left to the 3D shape model.

ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'addition': The application object specifies that the related document provides supplementary or collateral information with regard to the information provided by the relating document;
'copy': The application object defines a relationship where the related is a copy of the relating ;

'decomposition': The application object defines a relationship where the related is one of potentially more sub documents of the relating ; The decomposition of a document into clauses is an example for the use of this value.

'peer': The application object specifies that the related document provides required information with regard to that provided by the relating document. The peer document is essential for a complete understanding;
'reference': The application object defines a relationship where the related document is referenced from the relating; A hyperlink is an example for a 'reference'.
'sequence': The application object defines a logical sequence where the related comes after the relating ; A sequence of clauses.
'substitution': The application object defines a relationship where the related replaces the relating ;
'translation': The Document_definition_relationship specifies that the related document is generated through a translation process from the relating document.

A Document_location_identification is a type of
that specifies where a or a can be found in a digital or physical data storage system.

example.p: If these files were located within the same directory or relatively to the same directory, the source_id attribute would convey the directory name.

ul.li: 'URL' - for a web page;

In the case where a Document_size_property is referred by a , the size information is the sum of the sizes of all individual objects that are collected by this object, whereas in the case it is referred by a , the size information is the one of the individual objects that is referenced.

By inclusion of these types in a with name 'specification' and description 'specification of company XY' these types of documents are better classified and the meaning of 'specification type 1' and 'specification type 2' can be further detailed in an attached document to the or by a reference to a for document types with that organization.

ext_description.p: the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'derivation': The business object defines a deriving relationship where the related Document_version is based on the relating Document_version which is an earlier version of the same or of a different Document;

'hierarchy': The business object defines a hierarchical relationship where the related Document_version is a sub version of the relating Document_version; 'Revision 1.1' and 'revision 1.2' are examples of sub-versions of 'version 1'.
'sequence': The business object defines a version sequence where the relating Document_version is the preceding version and the related Document_version is the following version.

'supplied document': The business object defines a relationship between two Document_version objects representing the same object in different organizational contexts. The different organizational contexts can be represented by different general organizational data associations with the related Document_version objects.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An Effectivity is an identification of the valid use of an aspect of product data tracked by date, event, serial number or lot size.
An instance of Effectivity may define a period or a part of ineffectivity, i.e., of invalid use, if it is referred to by an instance of with 'effectivity_indication' set to 'false'.
A 'start' value shall always be specified for a particular type of Effectivity, an 'end' value may be specified.
This application protocol does not allow to specify effectivity or ineffectivity intervals without start values.
If period or lot-size are not specified, the effectivity or ineffectivity is endless.
An Effectivity may 'inherit' its interval from another Effectivity through an with relation_type 'inheritance'. If a 'start' and no 'end' is specified, the period or lot-size is then added to 'start' in order to get the actual 'end' of the effectivity or ineffectivity.
If both 'start' and 'end' are specified, the period should not be specified because of redundancy. If specified, it shall be equal to the measure between the 'start' and the 'end' of the effectivity or ineffectivity.
other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the Effectivity. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the set of objects in that the Effectivity is valid. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If concerned_organizations is an empty set, the Effectivity is globally applicable.
ext_description.example: The Effectivity of the same part may be different in the various production sites of a car manufacturer.
ext_description.note: As Effectivity is in most cases organization dependent, it is recommended always to populate the concerned_organizations attribute.
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the text that provides further information about the Effectivity.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the life cycle stage for which the Effectivity is valid. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the identifier for the Effectivity.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identification of a particular version of the Effectivity. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

An Effectivity_assignment associates an with the product or activity data whose effectivity is controlled by the associated . The association of an to product or activity data does not imply any statement concerning the effectivity outside of the specified interval. The same applies in the absence of any assigned effectivity, i.e. no statement concerning the effectivity is implied.
the instance of that is assigned.

specifies whether the assigned_effectivity defines a period of effectivity (value equal 'TRUE') or a period of ineffectivity (value equal 'FALSE') for the is_assigned_to. In the first case, use of is_assigned_to objects is or was valid during the considered period.
This does not imply that use of the is_assigned_to objects is mandatory.
In the second case, use of is_assigned_to objects is or was not valid during the considered period.
the objects whose are characterized by the assigned_effectivity.

ext_description.p: the text that specifies the purpose of the association of the with objects. For an that identifies a period of time, if applicable, the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'actual': The assigned_effectivity defines a period of time during which the associated objects are or were effective;
'planned': The assigned_effectivity defines a period of time during which the associated objects are or were expected to be effective;
'required': The assigned_effectivity defines a period of time during which the associated objects are or were required to be effective.

ext_description.p: An Effectivity_relationship is a relationship between two objects. The meaning of the relationship is represented by the relation_type attribute.
ext_description.note: Sometimes effectivity is not dependent on particular dates or serial numbers, but on the effectivity of other items. In this case end values are not instantiated, but are derived via an Effectivity_relationship to the reference .

the text that provides further information about the Effectivity_relationship.

ext_description.p: the first of the two objects related by the Effectivity_relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the text that specifies the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable, the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'constraint': The domain of the related shall be included in the domain of the relating .
'inheritance': The related shall not have an 'end' specified, but inherits the effectivity values from the relating .

ext_description.p: the value that describes the status of the evaluation. Where applicable, the following values shall be used:

'not_evaluatable': the evaluation is not conclusive;
'to_be_evaluated': the evaluation shall be performed;
valid: the evaluation is valid.

A File_relationship is a relationship between two objects. It specifies that the related is referenced from the relating . A service manual may contain graphics for explanatory reasons. In this case the objects that contain the graphics are referenced as related from the object that contains the body of the service manual with relation_type 'reference'.

the text that provides further information about the File_relationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the second of the two objects related by the File_relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the first of the two objects related by the File_relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the meaning of the relationship. The values 'addition', 'decomposition', and 'peer' are only allowed if neither the relating nor the related File are included in a . Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'addition': The application object specifies that the related document provides supplementary or collateral information with regard to the information provided by the relating document; The recommended practices for this part of ISO 10303 may be an addition.
'copy': The application object defines a relationship where the related File is a copy of the relating File;

'decomposition': The application object defines a relationship where the related File is one of potentially more sub documents of the relating File; The decomposition of a document into clauses or into several CAD models is an example for 'decomposition'.

'derivation': The business object defines a relationship where the related File is derived from the relating File; The derivation of a hypertext document from an text document is an example for 'derivation'.

'peer': The application object specifies that the related document provides required information with regard to that provided by the relating document. The peer document is essential for a complete understanding;
'reference': The application object defines a relationship where the related document is referenced from the relating one; The link in a hypertext document may be a reference.
'sequence': The application object defines a logical sequence where the related File comes after the relating File; A sequence of clauses is an example for 'sequence'.
'substitution': The application object defines a relationship where the related File replaces the relating File;
'translation': The application object specifies that the related document is generated through a translation process from the relating document.

ext_description.p: The values 'addition', 'decomposition', and 'peer' are used for the purpose of creating logical structures of documents. These values shall only be used for the relation_type of File_relationship, if the referenced objects do not participate in a . In the latter case, shall be used instead.

ext_description.p:
A General_shape_dependent_property is a type of
that defines a user-defined characteristic of an object. The 'property_value' specified by a General_shape_dependent_property is derived from geometry.
ext_description.note: The General_shape_dependent_property may be used for the purpose of validation of geometric models.
ext_description.example: If a geometry model is exchanged between two partners, the calculation of various properties of the bodies, such as centre of mass, overall surface, or overall volume, is performed by originator and recipient. When comparing these set of values, the existence of deficiencies in the received model can be easily detected.

ext_description.p: the type of characteristic that is specified for an object. The following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'centroid': The 'property_value' identifies the centre point of the mass of a body. The relative position of this point within the body is an invariant datum relative to rotation and translation.; An example, where the use of this General_shape_dependent_property with property_type 'centroid' is used instead of the object , is the following: sometimes the General_shape_dependent_property is calculated by some system at some point of time. But there are cases where the information, e.g., the General_shape_dependent_property of a die, is transferred into a following stage, e.g., in order to perform a feasibility check, where there is only a simplified shape representation that does not allow to calculate the exact General_shape_dependent_property. Yet, in this stage the information about the General_shape_dependent_property is needed in order to check whether the transport of a die with a crane is feasible.
'surface area': The 'property_value' specifies the overall surface of the bodies contained in the referenced shape.;
'volume': The 'property_value' specifies the overall volume of the bodies contained in the referenced shape.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the value that is given for a particular characteristic.
the unit in which the General_shape_dependent_property is expressed. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: An Information_right is a definition of what may or may not be done with an item of information in the sense of legal rights and obligations.
ext_description.example: Copyright is an Information_right.

For the purposes of developing a new system, details of government furnished equipment may be made available to a particular project team. The team may copy and use the information internally, but may not pass it on, either to a third part, or to another team, and must destroy the information at the end of the contract.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the additional identifiers that distinguishes the Information_right. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Information_right.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the words by which the Information_right is known.

ext_description.p: the text that describes any conditions and limitations that apply to the exercise of the right. The value of this attribute need not be specified. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.example: The description of the right states that copying is permitted within the project team only, whereas the restriction notes the additional constraint that the information must be destroyed at the end of the project.

ext_description.p: An Information_usage_right is an application an Information_right to a particular usage context.
ext_description.note: One view of the distinction between an Information_right and an Information_usage_right is that the Information_right represents a standard clause in a contract, whereas an Information_usage_right represents the fact that the clause is used in a particular contract.

The context for the usage can be defined through the contract which defines the right, the organization that grants the right, the person or organization which is granted the right, and any dates such as the starting or ending dates for the right. The meaning of each association is identified through the roles of the assignments, and these are defined through reference data.

The Approval of an Information_usage_right carries the meaning that the right is granted to all information items in the relevant context, as opposed to the approval of an Applied_information_usage_right which is limited to particular items.

Information_usage_right provides a mechanism for recording significant rights within a product database. The legal significance of the presence or absence of a right is outside the scope of this part of ISO 10303.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the additional identifiers that distinguishes the Information_usage_right. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the text that provides further information about the Information_usage_right. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the set of Information_rights granted under this usage.
the identifier for the Information_usage_right.
the words by which the Information_usage_right is known.

An Information_usage_right_assignment is an assignment of a particular usage right to a set of items. If an approval is applied to this entity, it carries the meaning that the particular set of items is approved for the given usage. This approval generally indicates that the approval is exceptional, for example, where the information belongs to another project, and that project agrees to share some particular items of information. There is a further implication that the set of entities should not be changed once the approval is given.
the right which is assigned to the items.
the set of information usage right items to which the usage right applies.

An Information_usage_right_relationship is a relationship of one Information_usage_right to another. Where one Information_usage_right supercedes another, then the original right is pointed to by the relating attribute, its replacement by the related attribute, and the relation_type attribute takes the value supercedes.
the text that provides further information about the Information_usage_right_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
one of the instances of Information_usage_right that is a part of the relationship.

the other instance of Information_usage_right that is a part of the relationship. If one Information_usage_right participating in the relationship is dependent upon the other, this attribute shall be the dependent one.
a role that defines the behaviour of the relationship.

ext_description.p: A Material_identification is an identification of the substance out of that one or more Parts are or can be made.
ext_description.example: The entity Part can be used to represent a raw material part, before it is used to manufacture products. The entity Material_identification would provide the name of the material for that Part.
ext_description.p: For the specification of the raw material from that a part is made, the object Part is used with an attached Part_category with classification type 'raw material'. That object represents the material item with possibly additional information, like identification of supplier, quantity, size of the raw stock etc. and it can be used in corresponding relationships such as Make_from_relationship or for a Process_operation_definition.

ext_description.p: A Part is a identification of definition of a part. It collects the definitional information of the versions of a part. A Part shall always be categorized as 'piece part', 'product', 'software', 'tool', or 'raw material' using a Part_category.
ext_description.note: A Part does not represent an actual physical object of the real world.
A Part may be either a single piece part, an assembly of arbitrary complexity, a raw material, or a tool.
ext_description.example: In the context of cars, a Part may be the car as a whole, the assembly of the engine, the car body, a fender, the side window glass, grease, or a stamping die.
In the context of airplanes, a Part may be the airplane as a whole, the assembly of the engine, the body of the airplane, a fender, the side window glass, grease, or a stamping die.
ext_description.note: A Part is identified by an organization. The definition of the domain of uniqueness and the mechanism for guaranteeing the uniqueness of Part id are outside the scope of this capability.
A Part may have zero or more versions. Versions of a Part are represented by the entity Part_version.

ext_description.p: A Part_category is a category of a Part with respect to specific criteria. The specific criteria are covered in the 'id' attribute.

For the attribute 'id' a set of predefined values is specified hereafter. If values other than the proposed ones are used, they should be of general categorizing nature. This kind of categorization ought not to be used to classify names or identifiers of objects, e.g., in order to classify part families; for this purposes ought to be used.

ul.li: 'derivation': The application object defines a deriving relationship where the related Part_version is based on the relating Part_version which is an earlier version of the same or of a different Part;

'hierarchy': The application object defines a hierarchical relationship where the related Part_version is a subordinate version of the relating Part_version; 'Rev. 1.1' and 'rev. 1.2' are subordinates of 'version 1'.

'sequence': The application object defines a version sequence where the relating Part_version is the preceding version of the related Part_version that is the following version. For a given Part_version there shall be at most one Part_version_relationship of this relation_type referring to this Part_version as 'relating' and at most one Part_version_relationship of this relation_type referring as 'related'

Each Part_version_view is a General_part_version_view, a Collection_definition, or an Assembly_definition.

ext_description.p: A Process_operation_definition is a specification of an activity that may be included in a Process_plan. A Process_operation_definition characterizes a manufacturing or control operation.
ext_description.note: Process_operation_definition as well as may be associated with organizational data using, e.g., . The reason for having these data available for both types of objects is the requirement to associate Process_operation_definition with organizational data in both a context independent and a context dependent way (the context is a particular ).

In the case where an instance of Process_operation_definition is associated with, e.g., two objects (e.g., as location), once context independent and once context dependent, the two locations need not be the same, but should be related in a way that the context dependent location should be a specialization of the context independent location (e.g., a particular assembly line in a plant).

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the additional identifiers used to distinguish the Process_operation_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Process_operation_definition.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Process_operation_definition.

the words by which the Process_operation_definition is known.
'operation Z10.114' is an example for name.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the type of the Process_operation_definition.
ext_description.example: 'stamping', 'milling', 'drilling', 'welding', 'casting', and 'painting' are examples for process_type.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the identification of a particular version of a Process_operation_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Process_operation_definition_relationship.

ext_description.p: the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'alternative': the application object defines a relationship where the related may be used alternatively instead of the relating ;
'substitution': the application object defines a relationship where the related replaces the relating ;

'version sequence': the application object defines a relationship where the relating is the preceding version and the related is the following version. In this case, both objects shall specify a version_id.

The reference coordinate system is either the coordinate system of the reference tool, if present for the concerned or, if no reference tool is present, the coordinate system of the itself.

specifies whether the identified element plays the role of an input or an output for the operation.

'simultaneity': the application object defines a relationship where the relating and the related objects are considered as occurring during the same time period;

ext_description.note: The criteria for 'simultaneity' and in particular the allowed delay between two objects declared simultaneous, are user-dependent.
See attribute 'cycle_time' for additional information.

ul.li: 'substitution': the application object defines a relationship where the related replaces of the relating .

The 'polishing' must not be started less than 2 hours after the 'painting' ended.

ext_description.note: The reference coordinate system is either the coordinate system of the reference tool (if present) for the concerned or (if no reference tool is present) the coordinate system of the itself. In the case where the value of the attribute reference_tool is 'true', no transformation shall be defined.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the rationale behind the use of the resource for a particular . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies whether or not the resource identified by the Process_operation_resource_assignment plays the role of the reference tool for the occurrence of an operation. In the case where the value of this attribute is 'true', all geometric transformations within the scope of the are defined with respect to the local coordinate system of the resource identified by the Process_operation_resource_assignment. There shall not be more than one resource playing the role of the reference tool for one . In the case where the resource is not represented as a , the value of the attribute reference_tool shall be 'false'.

ext_description.p: A Process_plan_relationship is a relationship between two objects.
ext_description.example: If a part shall be manufactured at two different manufacturing sites, e.g., one at Paris and the other at Bordeaux, there will be two different process plans, that may be related by a Process_plan_relationship.

the text that provides further information about the Process_plan_relationship.

ext_description.p: the first of the two objects related by the Process_plan_relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'alternative': the application object defines a relationship where the related Process_plan may be used alternatively to the relating Process_plan;

'version association': the application object defines a relationship where the related Process_plan is a version of the relating Process_plan. In this case, only the related Process_plan shall specify a version_id;

'version sequence': the application object defines a relationship where the relating Process_plan is the preceding version and the related Process_plan is the following version. In this case, both Process_plan objects shall specify a version_id.

ext_description.p:
A Process_state_relationship is a type of
that is a relationship between two Part_version_view objects where the relating Part_version_view is an in-process-item definition of a particular version of a Part. It characterizes a state of the Part_version that occurs before the state identified by the related Part_version_view.
ext_description.note: Process_state_relationship may be used to characterize intermediate states of the Part_version, if this Part_version is one of the produced outputs of a Process_plan.

ext_description.p: A Product_class is an identification of a set of similar products to be offered to the market. Product_class objects that are related to each other by a do not inherit any characteristics from each other.
ext_description.example: The following figure depicts a detail of an example of a structure that is built up by Product_class and objects.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the additional identifiers used to distinguish the Product_class. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Product_class.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Product_class.

the level of the Product_class in a hierarchical structure of Product_class objects.
A high level Product_class (level_type = 'enterprise') may be used to define all and objects for all Product_class objects of an enterprise with several brands and companies. A second level Product_class (level_type = 'platform') may be used to group all products that are based on the same technical concept (platform); these products may belong to different brands. A third level Product_class (level_type = 'car family') may be used to group all products that have a common base and a fixed set of characteristics (specification categories). A fourth level Product_class (level_type = 'car type') may represent products that are offered to the market; this level of Product_class may be defined by the marketing department. A set of specifications sufficient to produce the car is associated with its Product_class. Within this association, a distinction is made between standard characteristics (e.g. number of doors) and options that have to be chosen (e.g., outside colour) or that may be chosen by the customer (e.g., radio).
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the words or group of words by which the market of the Product_class is known. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the text that identifies a marketing category of the Product_class. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the words by which the Product_class is known.
ext_description.example: '69 Buick Electra', 'Bugatti Royal', 'Pacific 213', and 'Airbus A320' are examples for name.
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the identification of a particular version of a Product_class. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Product_class_relationship is a relationship between two objects. The meaning of this relationship is specified further by the attribute relation_type.

the text that provides further information about the Product_class_relationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the second of the two objects related by the Product_class_relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the first of the two objects related by the Product_class_relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'derivation': the Product_class_relationship defines a relationship where the related is derived from the relating ;
'substitution': the Product_class_relationship defines a relationship where the related replaces the relating ;
'version sequence': the Product_class_relationship defines a relationship where the relating is the preceding version and the related is the following version.

ext_description.p: A Product_configuration is a manufacturable object, or expected as so. A Product_configuration is defined with respect to the Product_class it is a member of.
ext_description.note: The kind of product that is to be manufactured from the data of the Product_configuration, is the kind of product that the member_of identifies a class of.
The intent of Product_configuration is the identification of one manufacturable object whereas the intent of Product_class is the gathering of products with similar characteristics.
ext_description.example: A Product_configuration that is associated with a Product_class that identifies a family of Diesel engines is intended to lead to the manufacture of a particular case of Diesel engine, and the Product_configuration that is associated with a Product_class that identifies a car family will lead to the manufacture of a car.
ext_description.note: The entity Product_configuration corresponds to the concept of configuration item defined, in some configuration management standards, as an item subject to configuration management.
ext_description.example: EXAMPLE 2 A Product_configuration may represent a component of a contracted product, onto which severe safety rules apply and for which configuration management is therefore rigorously applied.
ext_description.note: A Product_configuration may identify a variation of a Product_class, an entire Product_class, or some portion thereof.
A Product_configuration can be established prior to the existence of a corresponding product.
ext_description.p: For a Product_configuration one or more additional Specification objects may be specified. In this case they enhance the characterization provided for the associated Product_class.
ext_description.note: The actual set of Specification objects for a Product_configuration are obtained by the union of 'defining_specifications' and of the Specification objects related to the 'associated_product_class' through a Class_specification_association or a Class_condition_association with association_type 'identification' or 'non replaceable standard'.

The specification of a Product_configuration may be incomplete: there may not be in 'defining_spe-cification' any instance of Specification for some Specification_category declared as mandatory for the 'associated_product_class'. For these Specification_category objects any Specification available in the context of the 'associated_product_class' is considered as valid for the manufacturing of the product characterized by the considered Product_specification.
ext_description.example: If the colour is not specified for a given car family, the vehicle resulting from the realization ofa Product_configuration associated to the Product_class representing the car family may be without paint or painted in any available colour.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the additional identifiers used to distinguishes the Product_configuration. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the set of Specification objects necessary to discriminate the Product_specification within its Product_class. Each defining_specification shall be associated with a Product_class by a Class_specification_association with association_type not equal 'part usage'. The associated Product_class shall be either the associated Product_class of the Product_configuration or any higher level Product_class related directly or indirectly by a Product_class_relationship with a relation_type 'hierarchy'. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the text that provides further information about the Product_configuration. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Product_configuration.
the Product_class that a Product_configuration belongs to.

the words by which the Product_configuration is known.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identification of a particular version of a Product_configuration. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Product_configuration_relationship is a relationship between two Product_configaration objects. The meaning of this relationship is specified further by the attribute relation_type.

the text that provides further information about the Product_configuration_relationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: specifies the second of the two Product_configuration objects related by the Product_configuration_relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: specifies the first of the two Product_configuration objects related by the Product_configuration_relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: specifies the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'hierarchy': the Product_configuration_relationship defines a relationship where the relating Product_configuration is on a higher level in the hierarchy of Product_configuration objects than the related Product_configuration;

'version sequence': the Product_configuration_relationship defines a relationship where the relating Product_configuration is the preceding version and the related Product_configuration is the following version.

ext_description.p: A Product_design_association is a is a mechanism to associate an Part_version with its corresponding Product_configuration. It specifies the explicit design that corresponds to the Product_configuration. The Product_design_association represents the statement that, in all definition contexts, the Product_version is a valid way to implement the Product_configuration.
ext_description.note: The Product_design_association might not be valid for other Part_version objects.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the Part_version that identifies a part which is a valid implementation for the Product_configuration, i.e. meets the requirements specified by the Product_configuration.
the Product_configuration that represents the requirements for which a Part_version as solution is designated.

ext_description.p: A Project is an identified program of work.
ext_description.note: A Project may be further characterized by planned or actual dates, allowed budget, or resources.
ext_description.example: For the development of a new car, a project is set up that is responsible for the development decisions as well as for the accounting of the costs.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the point in time when the Project was actually finished. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the point in time when the Project was actually started. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the Project. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Project.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Project.

ext_description.p: the words by which the Project is known.
Informal proposition: There shall be exactly one object that defines the name of a Project.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: either the point in time when the Project is or was supposed to be finished or the planned duration of the Project. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If present, there shall be exactly one object that defines the planned_end_date for a Project.

the point in time when the execution of the Project is or was expected to start. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If present, there shall be exactly one object that defines the planned_start_date for a Project.
the set of Organizations that are responsible for the Project. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Project_assignment is an association of a with activity or product data.
the that is assigned to activity or product data.

the set of activity or product data to which the is assigned.
Informal proposition: There shall be at least one object that the Project_assignment is assigned to.

ext_description.p: the relationship of the with respect to the object that it is assigned to. Where applicable, the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'project scope': the assigned objects are defined within the project, i.e. the project is the owner of the assigned objects.

'project correspondence': the assigned object represents a correspondence to the project. There shall be a 1:1 correspondence between the project and the assigned object. Assigned objects are limited to be of types or .
Informal proposition: Only one assigned object allowed for a Project_assignment with role = 'project correspondence'.
'work program': the assigned objects are carried out in the . In this case, the assigned objects shall be only of type .
'affected objects': the assigned objects are affected by the work carried out by the .

ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the second of the two objects related by the Project_relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent of the other, this attribute shall be the independent or owning one.

ext_description.p: the text that specifies the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable, the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'decomposition': The related is one of the components into which the relating is broken down with no implication of 'sequence' or 'dependency';

'dependency': The issuing or completion of the related is dependent on the issuing or completion of the relating ;
The value 'dependency' does not imply the semantics of the values 'decomposition' or 'sequence'.
'sequence': The relating shall be completed before the related starts;
'succession': The related is the successor of the relating .

ext_description.p: Informal proposition: The graph of instances of , related by instances of , shall be acyclic.

ext_description.p: A Requirement is a used to uniquely identify a requirement.
ext_description.note: The term "requirement" is used here in the sense that term is used in systems engineering and similar industrial domains.

There may be many versions of a requirement Requirement_version. The requirement entity is simply a placeholder for holding a unique requirement. More associations and assignment could be done through the Requirement or the Requirement_version.
Systems engineering tools and organizations may use differing identification mechanisms. Multiple identifiers may be assigned to a requirement using additional_ids attribute.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the others identifiers that distinguish the requirement for others systems. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Requirement.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Requirement.
the words by which the Requirement is known.
the Organization or the Person_in_organization that has created the Requirement. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the versions of the Requirement.

ext_description.p: A Requirement_assignment is an object used to relate a Requirement to data types representing the items that are affected by the requirement.
ext_description.example: A requirement "the vehicle shall have a maximum power output of at least 150BHP" could be assigned to the data types which are used to represent the vehicle's engine.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the others identifiers that distinguish the Requirement_assignment. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the Requirement or the Requirement_version which is assigned.

the item which has the requirement assigned to it.

It identifies a collection relationship.
