ext_description.p: A Requirement_satisfaction_assertion is a relationship between an item and a requirement, asserting that the item satisfies the identified requirement.
ext_description.example: A data type used to represent a vehicle's engine with a power output of 160BHP could be asserted to satisfy a requirement "the vehicle shall have a maximum power output of at least 150BHP".

the requirement_assignment that is satisfied by the Requirement_satisfaction_assertion. The value of this attribute need not be specified. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the items that satisfies the requirement.
the requirement that is satisfied.

ext_description.p: A Requirement_source_association is a relationship between a requirement and the data types representing the source of the requirement.
ext_description.example: The source of the requirement "the vehicle shall have a maximum power output of at least 150BHP" could be a document representing the findings of a market survey of sports car buyers.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the others identifiers that distinguish the Requirement_source_association. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the items which are the source of the requirement.

the text that provides further information about the Requirement_source_association.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the identifier for the Requirement_source_association.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the Requirement or Requirement_version which is to be related to its source.

A Requirement_tracing_relationship is a type of
It identifies a tracing relationship.

ext_description.p: A Requirement_version is the identification of a particular version of a requirement.
ext_description.note: This entity is used to record different versions of a requirement. In this case, the word "version" implies "revision" - that is a particular release of a requirement.
ext_description.example: A given requirement might have versions 1.0, 1.1, 1.2 and 2.0.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the text that provides further information about the Requirement_version.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Requirement_version.
the Requirement for which the Requirement_version identifies a version.

A Requirement_version_relationship is a type of relationship that is used to relate previous version (related) of a requirement to the version that replaces it (relating). A Requirement_version_relationship is either a General_requirement_version_relationship, a Requirement_sequence_relationship, a Requirement_tracing_relationship, a Requirement_collection_relationship or a Requirement_decomposition_relationship.
the others identifiers that distinguish the Requirement_version_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Requirement_version_relationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the identifier for the Requirement_version_relationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the old version of the Requirement.
the new version of the requirement that replace the old Requirement_version.

ext_description.p:
A Same_time_machining_relationship is a type of
relationship between two Part_instance objects that specifies that those two objects shall be manufactured together within the same Process_operation_occurrence.
ext_description.example: The following figure shows an example for this case.

ext_description.p: specifies the geometrical Transformation between the local coordinate system of the related Part_instance with respect to the local coordinate system of the relating Part_instance.
ext_description.note: The transformation is needed to position the related Part_instance with respect to the relating Part_instance for the same time machining process.
ext_description.p: In the case where the placement is realized by a Template_instance the scale factor of that Template_instance shall be omitted or set to 1. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Serial_configuration is a type of
that applies onwards from a given serial number of the product that is considered within the object referred to as 'is_solution_for'.

ext_description.p: the serial number of that instance of the product that is the last instance for which the Serial_configuration applies. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.note: If the serial_end_number is not specified, it is not foreseen that the Serial_configuration ceases to be valid; i.e., the Serial_configuration is expected to apply to all serial numbers greater than the serial start number for the product for whose characteristics the Serial_configuration identifies a solution.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the serial number of that instance of the product that is the first instance for which the Serial_configuration applies.
A Serial_effectivity is a type of for which the domain of applicability is defined as a possibly open-ended interval of serial numbers.

the last valid serial number. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If the value for this attribute is not specified, the interval of applicability has no upper bound or it is implicitely defined via an with relation_type 'inheritance'.
the first valid serial number.

ext_description.p: A Shape_dependent_property is a characteristic of the shape, or of a portion of the shape of an object. This object is either a , an occurrence of an in the product structure or the physical realization of an .
ext_description.note: A Shape_dependent_property is independent of the representations of the shape.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the object that the Shape_dependent_property is associated to.

specifies the in which the property is applicable.
The values of geometry related properties are specified relative to a . A may be specified in different coordinate spaces for different dimensioning applications.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: A Simple_property is a simplified mechanism to associate a property value with an object.
ext_description.note: A Simple_property corresponds in the more detailed independent property concept to a or

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the object that is characterized by the .
The attribute is_assigned_to of Simple_property corresponds in the more detailed independent property concept to .is_assigned_to or to .is_assigned_to
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the property type that the Simple_property characterizes.
ext_description.note: The attribute property_type of Simple_property corresponds in the more detailed independent property concept to the attribute property_type of which is a subtype of and which is referenced by the attribute definition of . The itself is referenced by .assigned_property
ext_description.example: noise absorption, power consumption or 'colour' are examples for the value_type of a Simple_property.

ext_description.p: specifies the that qualifies the Simple_property by a , a , or a .
ext_description.note: The attribute specified_value of Simple_property corresponds in the more detailed independent property concept to the attribute specified_value of the that itself is referenced by .assigned_property.

ext_description.p: A Specification is a characteristic of a product. A Specification discriminates one product from other members of the same . A Specification refers to a that completes the semantics of the Specification.
ext_description.note: A Specification may be a characteristic of the members of more than one using objects.
A Specification in combination with a may be used to define under which conditions a is used in combination with a .
ext_description.example: 'coupe', 'hatch back', or 'sedan' are examples for specifications belonging to the of type 'car body'. 'radio 1 with CD player' and 'radio 2 without CD player' are examples for specifications belonging to the of type 'radio equipment'. 'disk brake' and 'drum brake' are examples for specifications belonging to the of type 'braking system'.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the additional identifiers used to distinguish the Specification. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the that completes the semantics of the Specification.

the text that provides further information about the Specification.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the identifier for the Specification.
ext_description.note: The scope of uniqueness is usually dependent on the form of implementation.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the words by which the Specification is known.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: specifies whether this Specification represents a package of Specification objects or not. Such a Specification combines those Specification objects that shall be offered to the market as a set. In the case where package is 'true', there shall be exactly one per Product_class considered, that refers to this Specification by its aqttribute if_condition. The Specification objects that are members of the package, shall be specified in the attribute included_specification of the .
ext_description.note: Commercial packages may be defined by the marketing department.
Usually the members of a package belong to distinct objects.
ext_description.example: A sports package contains sports seats, a special steering wheel, special tyres and wheels. A winter package contains heated front seats, heated windshield washers, heated exterior mirrors, and special tyres.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the identification of a particular version of a Specification. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: A Specification_category is a definition of a set of objects serving the same purpose.
ext_description.example: The category 'kind of drive' for the objects 'front wheel drive' and 'rear wheel drive' or the category 'level of equipment' for the objects 'standard', 'comfortable', and 'luxurious' are examples for Specification_category objects.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the additional identifiers used to distinguish the Specification_category. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the text that provides further information about the Specification_category.
ext_description.example: The description 'trim' characterizes a Specification_category for objects that controls the quality and colour of the interior parts including, e.g., inner door panels and upholstery. Other examples are 'kind of drive', 'rear brake type', 'brake power regulator', 'radio equipment', or 'type of car body'.

ext_description.p: the identifier for the Specification_category.
ext_description.example: The scope of uniqueness may be set by the extent of a physical file or database.
ext_description.note: The scope of uniqueness is usually dependent on the form of implementation.

ext_description.p: specifies whether the objects within the Specification_category are mutually exclusive for the production of one particular product. A value of 'true' indicates that the referenced objects are mutually exclusive for the production of the particular product.
ext_description.example: 'safety equipment' is an example for a non mutually exclusive Specification_category if, e.g., ABS and airbag are objects in this category. 'engine' is an example for a Specification_category with an implicit_exclusive_condition since usually only one engine can be mounted for power supply.
ext_description.note: More complex conditions can be handled using objects.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Specification_category_hierarchy is a used to build up hierarchical structures of objects.
the lower level of in Specification_category_hierarchy.
the higher level of in Specification_category_hierarchy.
A Specification_expression is a combination of objects formed by Boolean operations.
the additional identifiers used to distinguish the Specification_expression. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Specification_expression.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the identifier for the Specification_expression.
ext_description.note: The scope of uniqueness is usually dependent on the form of implementation.
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the operands of the Boolean operation that are either objects or other Specification_expression objects. In case the_operation is 'not' there shall be exactly one operand.

ext_description.p: the kind of Boolean operation. The following kinds of operations are permitted:

ul.li: 'and': all of the identified objects shall be used;
'or': a subset or all of the identified objects shall be used;
'oneof': exactly one of the identified objects shall be used;
not': The identified shall not be used. 'not' is an unary operation.

ext_description.p: A Specification_inclusion is a representation of the statement that specifies that the application of a or of a implies the inclusion of an additional or .
ext_description.example: The source of such a completion may be a customer order.
ext_description.note: The Specification_inclusion is intended to complete the set of objects for a in order to enable the manufacturing of the product on the basis of an initial set of objects defined.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the additional identifiers used to distinguish the Specification_inclusion. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the text that provides further information about the Specification_inclusion. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the identifier for the Specification_inclusion.
The scope of uniqueness is usually dependent on the form of implementation.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the or the that serves as the condition for the inclusion.

ext_description.p: the or the objects that are to be included. The included_specification shall not reference a with an operation of type 'or' or 'oneof', except for negating expressions, i.e., as participants in an expression preceded by a 'not' operator. Expressions of operator 'not' shall not be nested within one another.
In the case where more than one is to be included a of type 'and' shall be used.
ext_description.note: In the case where the included_specification is a 'not' expression, the object actually defines an exclusion.

ext_description.p:
A Tool_part_relationship is a type of
that is a relationship between two Part_version_view objects. It establishes a relationship between a part (related) and a tool (relating) that is used to produce the part.
ext_description.example: This relationship is, by default, valid only in the application contexts that are relevant for both related Part_version_view objects.

ext_description.p: specifies the relative position of the Item representing the part with respect to the local coordinate system of the Item representing the tool. In the case where the placement is realized by a Template_instance, the scale factor of that Template_instance shall be omitted or set to 1. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the technology that is used to manufacture the part using this tool and, possibly, the reasons for the use of a particular technology. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Unit is a quantity chosen as a standard in terms of which other quantities may be expressed. The types of units supported by this standard are SI units as well as derived or conversion based units as defined in ISO 10303-41.

ext_description.p: specifies the system in which the Unit is defined.
ext_description.example: 'SI system'

ext_description.p: the words by which the Unit is known.
ext_description.example: 'meter', 'gram', 'gram','litre', or 'volt' are examples for the name.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies a possible prefix for the name.
'milli', 'kilo' are examples for the prefix
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
A Value_limit is a type of
with a qualified numerical value representing either the lower limit or the upper limit of a particular physical characteristic.
ext_description.example: '30.5 max' and '5 min' are examples for a Value_limit.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the value of the limit.

ext_description.p: specifies the kind of the limit. The following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'maximum': The specified limit is an upper limit;
'minimum': The specified limit is a lower limit.

ext_description.p:
A Value_list is a type of
with an ordered collection of Property_value objects.
ext_description.example: A may be composed of different property values such as 'mass', 'speed', and 'age' which are altogether necessary in a given context. The Value_list collects all of them in a given order, such that each is identifiable by its index in the list.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the ordered collection of objects that together are provided as a .

A Value_range is a type of
with apair of numerical values representing the range in which the value shall lie.
specifies the minimum acceptable value that is constrained by the Value_range.
specifies the maximum acceptable value that is constrained by the Value_range.

A Value_with_unit is a type of
with either a single numerical measure, or a range of numerical measures with upper, lower, or upper and lower bounds.

specifies the number of decimal digits that are relevant for the use of the Value_with_unit. If present, the numerical measure or range may be specified using more digits than the significant digits but shall not be specified using less digits. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the unit in which the Value_with_unit is expressed.

ext_description.p: A Work_order is the authorization for one or more Activity objects to be performed.
ext_description.note: One or more means that it is controlling the main activity and any sub-activity related to the activity by Activity_relationship with relation_type of 'decomposition'.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the additional identifiers that distinguish the Work_order. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the text that provides further information about the Work_order. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Work_order.
the set of zero, one or more instances of Work_request that define the expected results. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the Activity objects that are controlled by this particular Work_order.

ext_description.p: the work_order_type specifies the kind of the Work_order. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'design deviation permit': An authorization for a deviation from the approved design data;
'design release': An authorization for the design of a product or of an item or to create a bill of material;
'management resolution': An authorization by a committee, such as the board of directors, to design or change an item;
'manufacturing release': An authorization for the manufacturing process of a product or of an item;
'production deviation permit': An authorization for a deviation from the approved manufacturing process.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the identification of a particular version of a Work_order. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: A Work_request is a solicitation for some work to be done.
ext_description.note: These requests may not be acted upon depending on the authorization granted to the request or its associated Work_order.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the additional identifiers that distinguish the Work_request. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the text that provides further information about the Work_request. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Work_request.
the personnel that shall be informed about the Work_request and the date when the personnel or organization shall be informed. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the intention of the Work_request.

ul.li: 'change of standard': A request to translate a change to a standard into action;
'cost reduction': A request aimed at reducing the engineering and manufacturing costs of an item;
'customer rejection': A request resulting from a rejection by a customer;
'customer request': A request for an activity that is necessary to solve the request of a customer;
'durability improvement': A request aimed at extending the life time of an item;
'government regulation': A request resulting from legal requirements;
'procurement alignment': A request to adjust the purchasing process of different items;
'production alignment': A request to adjust the manufacturing process of different items;
'production relief': A request aimed at achieving a simpler assembly and production process;
'production requirement': A request for an activity that is necessary from a production point of view;
'quality improvement': A request aimed at increasing the quality of an item;
'security reason': A request for an activity that is necessary from a security point of view;
'standardization': A request to unify variants of an item;
'supplier request': A request for an activity necessary to solve the request of a supplier;
'technical improvement': A request aimed at improving the technical aspects of an item;
'tool improvement': A request aimed at increasing the useful life of a tool.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the person or organization who issued the Work_request and the date when this person or organization issued the Work_request. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the objects that are subject to the Work_request. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the text that provides a user interpretable designation for the level of completion of the study and resolution of the Work_request.
ext_description.example: The designations 'drafted', 'issued', 'deferred', 'in-hand', 'completed', 'cancelled', and 'rejected' are examples of request status.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the identification of a particular version of a Work_request. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Work_request_relationship is a relationship between two Work_request objects.

the text that provides further information about the Work_request_relationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the second of the two Work_request objects related by the Work_request_relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the first of the two Work_request objects related by the Work_request_relationship. The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the meaning of the relationship.
ext_description.example:
Where applicable the following values shall be used:
'dependency': The related Work_request is dependent on the relating Work_request.
ext_description.note: This means that the related Work_request has the same Work_request direction as the relating Work_request;
